Music Education Applied Piano Lesson.Description: This course is designed to support the continued training and development of piano skills needed in the elementary, secondary choral, and private vocal studio setting. This course is only for Bachelor of Music, Music Education majors in the Vocal, Guitar, or Keyboard concentration.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in piano and related instruments
Understanding of music pedagogy and educational technology
Development of instructional materials for music education
Application of music theory in teaching settings
Knowledge of vocal and instrumental techniques
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with students and peers
Creating a sense of community in educational settings
Mentoring and guiding emerging music educators
Engaging students in collaborative music activities
Building relationships with diverse student populations
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Designing instructional strategies for music education
Analyzing and adapting teaching methods for different contexts
Developing solutions for classroom management challenges
Encouraging critical and creative thinking in music
Evaluating the effectiveness of music education programs
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Planning and organizing music lessons and seminars
Time management in educational and performance settings
Leading workshops and community music events
Strategic planning for music education curriculum

Freshman Seminar 1 for Music Education S.Description: This course is designed to help students make the most out of their experience as a student at ODU, create a sense of community among music education majors, and prepare students for the expectations of being a college student in the Diehn School of Music.

Freshman Seminar II for Music Education.Description: This course provides a professional community for emerging music educators. Discussion and fieldwork will focus on the application of instructional and learning strategies for guiding critical and creative music thinking, teaching and learning in a variety of music educational contexts.
